article:
A 'phosphoramidite' (RO) 2PNR 2 is a monoamide of a
phosphite diester. The key feature of phosphoramidites is their markedly high
reactivity towards nucleophiles catalyzed by weak acids e.c., triethylammonium
chloride or 1H-tetrazole. In these reactions, the incoming nucleophile replaces
the NR 2 moiety.
